definition: remote/hidden away/secluded/serene/peaceful/to imprison/in superstition indicates the underworld/ancient district spanning Liaonang and Hebei provinces
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
sentences.chinese: 极其幽微的一线盼望就足以点燃爱的火花。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, the truly profound interactions that move us can only be perceived when our hearts are calm.
sentences.chinese: 然而真正幽微动人的互动，必须用沈静的心来感知。

definition: distantly remote/also written 邈遠|邈远[miao3 yuan3]
serene and hidden in depth or distance
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
dismal/somber/also written 淒暗|凄暗[qi1 an4]
to contain/to hold/content/(of a poem etc) full of implicit meaning
to float about/(of a feeling) to show on the face/(of speech, friendship etc) shallow/vague
